reviews.review_msg: She turned me off math for life! I don't think she was a mean person or anything, I just think she expected way too much from first year students!
The worst prof ever!! Heed my warning and stay away from this class! Very boring lectures, very difficult exams and midterms! This class brought me down!
Her midterms and finals questions are way off the questions she gives in class and mock exams.

our  final exam average was rougly below 40% and it was worth 50% of our mark!!!! so go figure how bad of a teacher she must be!!!! coz you can't possibly say that the 400 students in that class were all complete idiots!!!! SHE WAS THE ONE NOT ABLE TO TEACH PROPERLY!
Mamolo is the worst prof Ive had at SFU so far, just about everyone failed the class. Stay away!!!

dont ever take courses with this teacher in your whole life. In Winter 08 term almost 80% of the students failed the course but she doesnt even curve or scale. People complains on webct and she doesnt care. Worst Prof in SFU and Math 100 just become so famous because of her

omg she is horrible! please please please!! dont take this unless you are confident you know everything because she donest teach. honestly, i didnt learn anything from her. she is nice and willing to help at the workshop but her lectures really suck. honestly...i've never seen such a bad teacher. maybe becuase shes young?

I have never been so lost in a subject in all my life. The prof was not helpful at all. Midterms and finals were brutal and everything explained in class was so easy in comparison to the tests. It killed my GPA...I wish I had never taken it; especially since I now know I didn't need it for my degree. All I can say is don't take this course!

Although her explination during class was fine, one example of the simplest case in class did not prepare for the HARDEST case possible that was on the exams. in that sence, fine at teaching, HORRIBLE at testing, completely unfair grading she failed the majority of my class even though the homework mark was average.

didn't she like fail the entire class? Gosh I wish I had never taken her class, what did she expect from us? Like hello, we're people who haven't taken math 12 or math for years, she was making us do hardcore calculus crap, useless

extremely hard class. she is awful at teaching the material. and she makes everything much harder than it seems. be prepared to learn everything yourself or through a tutor. ami also doesnt really care if you understand the material or not.
real hard exams and the classes are really boring...

i wish i checked ratemyprof before i took this class. the class is suppose to be a review of math12 but ami makes it so much more difficult. the examples that she gives in class are way easier than the hw. also she doesnt like to help if you dont understand, and she will often treat you like an idiot and she can act very arrogant
AVOID, Worst prof ever. Makes everything super hard, and has the hardest exams ever. Promised an easy final to boost the class average, but instead made it much harder then the midterms.

She is definitely one of the WORST prof in SFU. If you are not up to challenge, do not attempt to this course cause she will kill your GPA. our current class avg is about a D - C-.. This course is not curved btw..

Hard teacher. She is trying to make everything simpler, but for me it is just more comfusing. I found the textbook is more useful than her notes. Very harsh on marking, too. No bellcurve when class avg is D and C-...AVOID!! regret taking her class
The class avg for the first mid-term was 45 and second mid-term was 51 and she told us that she's not going to curve it.AVIOD HER unless you want to get a D or lower.
Very strict. Expect a lot from students

I would avoid taking her class at all costs. She makes the easiest concepts complicated; her exams are so much harder than previous years for the same course (older ones were on webCT). Be prepared to learn everything through the textbook/internet.
Our class average was well above other classes. I'm learning lots!

thinks the low class grades are because of students idiocy. talks to the class like we're suffering from idiocy. blaims her mistakes on class idiocy. learn to love the textbook cuz you'll be spending lots and lots of time with when she teaches you nothing. picks the easiest examples to go over in class and leaves the hard stuff to tests

AVOID, unless you are naturally gifted in Math. She does not care if the whole class fails. Does not scale. She blames the students and never considers that maybe its her teaching. Has no compassion for her students. During tutorials gets annoyed if you ask her for help. Worst Prof I have ever taken so far.
took a whole class to teach how to translate a function. mumbles and talks to herself

better get that textbook ready cuz u'll be doing ALL the learning from there, not her. thinks poor grades are due to lazy students, not her ridiculously bad teaching. makes things like completing squares complicated! like stuff we learned in high school that i could do when i was 14!! so boring to listen to in class, attitude SUCKS. WORST prof ever
So monotone and sux 2 teaching even people who took math 12 and calculus do poorly in her class

OMG. absolute worst i've seen in my 4 years at sfu. condescending attitude, makes mistakes in class and blames the students "you guys should've caught me...you need to know this stuff!". plus she wastes class time like crazy waiting for people to answer her dumb questions. it's not that we don't understand, we DON'T CARE! ugh...avoid!!
She is very hard to understand....makes things way more complicated then they are..i wouldnt suggest taking one of her classes unless you have to!!
She is very detailed in explanation and keeps your attention during class by asking the class how to solve a question or whatnot.
NOT EASY...BUT GOOD.
She is horrible at responding emails, she has good teaching skills yet she seems arrogant. so if you have questions to ask, ask in class or just swallow them in your stomach.

She does have a boring voice, but if you really pay attention during lecture, everything will be fine.
 Midterm exams weren't too difficult but watch out on the final, it's a bit trickier.
I actually really liked this math class.  I've had trouble with math in the past and I was able to get an A in her class so she must be doing something right!
she's a good lecturer.
A really bad prof. Her letures are totally confusing. She seems like never preparing for her lectures.

I found her lectures entirely useless. i would go to her class and not understand a single thing she was teaching, then i would go off and study the material in the text and it would make sense in moments. she makes easy topics and material difficult!

very unclear notes, monotone..her notes are useless because she does everything the harder way and explains things u dont need to know like why the quadratic eqn is the way it is..for math 100? we dont need to know that!
Great prof, just do the online works assigned and go to the math clinics. very nice and detailed about the questions that people get stuck on.

Genuinely one of the best profs at SFU. The course has quite a bit of work but it prepares you well for the quizzes and exams. Some exam questions were kind of difficult but nothing out of pocket. He's super understanding and wants his students to succeed. Would def recommend.

As long as you do the work you will get a well deserved mark. He doesn't stray from his sample questions for midterms and finals.

He has prerecorded videos that you need to watch before lectures, then he'll present practice questions in class. I found that really helpful. Hoping I can have him for more calculus classes, he really was very helpful.

He assigns a fair amount of work but it's not unreasonable. The setup for the class is kinda unusual in the way that you have video lectures to watch 3 times a week that are due the night before every class. It really only works if you stay on track with the schedule as class time is spent solving problems. Lots of ways to get easy marks tho
He is a pretty chill prof that actually cares that the students in his class learn and understand the material.
good prof, my favorite at sfu, im a fan
SUPERCOOL DUDE!!!!!!!!!!! USES ONLINE PLATFORMS THAT MAKE LEARNING EASY!!!!! WHADDAGUY!!!!!!!

Greatest prof of all time, funny lectures, tough course, he makes the first exam extremely hard, making everyone score very low to maximize pressure throughout the semester. Class average on mid term 1 was 42%. Rewarding learning experience for sure.

Justin a great prof. He gives lots of free marks roughly 30-40% of his class is easy marks. He teaches Ina unique and good method which is online lectures which you can view multiple times and he does weekly quizzes which are based on the homework. If you do the homework you'll ace the quizzes because there just homework question. Great teacher!

He is certified DILF. Good prof and clear instructions. Tests were straight forward and based on the course material. A lot good chunk of the grade was based on participation. To prepare for the exams, just review the sample test and you should be good.

Justin is a really nice guy who seems like he really cares about his students. His class was extremely homework heavy. I found myself doing work for that class 6-7 days/week. His tests were a bit hard but a lot of part marks were given so they were fair. Just make sure you practice!

Justin Gray is very nice and friendly, always willing to meet with students after class and accommodate their needs/absences. The exams were not difficult if you did the homework and attended most lectures. Honestly, most of the people complaining are just not strong in math, as he had very fair exams and quizzes that were exactly from the hw.

This prof is the worst, and his exams were unbelievably tricky and brutal, as they are nothing compared to the lectures he prerecords on canvas. His explanation that Justin had taught in class doesn't make clear sense of the material. But DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM b/c upon the final exam will be more challenging, plus you will fail.

worst math teacher/prof i've ever had. each class was just mc iclicker q's that had nothing to do with material you're tested on. the exams were extremely difficult as whatever he taught in the online lectures was just base level and wouldn't go into depth like on exams. there were about 40 questions of homework every week that were kind of helpful

Prof Gray, was a kind and thoughtful person, but he sucks at explaining. He made lectures worth participation marks, but didnt teach any material in class. All of the material was learnt by yourself on your own time with video lectures that werent explained well.

I'm unsatisfied with the way he taught in class during the lecture. He usually gives us some boring iClicker M.C Qs in lect. The exams were a total nightmare + more brutal, and solving problems in our clinic discussion was complex. Still, I've recommended not to TAKE THIS CLASS w/ him if you're taking math courses this semester.

Take it during the COVID year with online classes. His Iclicker question is completely different from his questions on the exam so be prepared. Having a quiz each week so be prepared for that. Hard to find him throughout the semester but glad that he organized more office hours right before the final exam period.

Very disrespectful towards students. Don't bother emailing him or asking him questions in class because he will just shoo you away as if you're a waste of time. His midterms are NOTHING like what is taught in class. Get ready to take a 10 page midterm with extremely ridiculous questions that you will only have an hour to do. He is very intimidating

Math 100s going to be a difficult course as it prepares you for calculus. I'm glad I took this class with Justin as he gives lots of homework, practice questions, as well as many sample exams. They were very generous with grading, giving out lots of partial marks and about 20% of the grade was participation in lecture (iclicker) and in the clinics.

Justin was an incredible teacher, he always tried to accommodate and was really kind with wanting his students to succeed. But like any math class you have to out the effort you want and practice! if you practice, ask questions, and watch his lectures you'll be all good.
All in all, good professor

Great professor and goes over and beyond to help you. Took this course twice, second time with him and there was a huge difference in the way he taught it. Very kind and lectures are great! He helped me very much!

All lectures were prerecorded so you have to watch them the day before class and they can be 40+ mins long. Theres online and off-line homework every week. The online homework doesn't make any sense and doesn't apply to lectures at all. Tests are pretty hard but the quizzes were easy since they're taken from the homework. Be ready to work hard!

Absolute worst math prof ever. Good effort to try a different learning method however he's not well enough at explaining to pull it off. Barely shows his steps. Don't rely on him to teach you because you'll have to learn everything yourself. His exams are unbelievably difficult and he's not accessible outside of class at all.

He prerecords his lectures and they honestly do not help at all. In class iClicker questions are useless, and homework and quizzes are nothing like his exams. I failed all of my exams, but somehow still passed the course. I genuinely thought I would have to retake this course, which heightened my depression.

He is the worst professor I have ever had. Failed me for 1%. During this pandemic didnt even consider my request or reply to me. Would never take a class with him and I highly recommend you to never take a class with him because you will 100% fail the course
Justin is probably one of the best profs in the math department if not the best, hes great at explaining complex stuff and exams are fair, hes quizzes are hard tough.

He's a very hard teacher. Even if you've taken precal previously this course will still most likely be challenging with him. Don't rely on his notes, self teach yourself. Get help as much as possible if you need to. His final was really difficult compared to his midterms imo. Attend class for participation marks. Do LOTS of homework practice.
Justin was a nice guy, but u have to do as much practices as you can.. the test are fair, do some work and you'll pass.
his lecture is a bit boring but the course is not curved!
the teacher was nice, but he expects student to know everything b4 teaching, the lectures were useless does not matter if you go there or not. for the exams justin loves to test definitions.
One of the best prof's/Teachers I've ever had!
the overall rating i have given is 1/5. his lectures are difficult to understand and mids and finals are too tough. most of the concepts in exams are not even taught in class. would never recommend.

Hard to get a good grade in his class, and mostly do not reply to students' questions. Most importantly, his quizzes and tests are extremely harder than his lectures. Not a good professor. I do not recommend him.

Lots of homework with this professor since that is the way he takes attendance in his online classes. Also, he is very test heavy. Having two tests within three months and a very difficult final exam. Also, the concepts he teach are often also inadequate to equip you for the various quizzes or tests that take place every 2 weeks.
He has passion for math but I barely understood what he was talking about. A lot of homework and midterms are kinda tough. He is going too fast through the lectures
his lecture is simple but a little bit boring. will fall asleep if u take this in the morning. paper is not too difficult , is at the normal level.
he is a nice professor ,he makes you practice the stuff on midterms through his quizzes. i would highly recommend to chose him,follow his notes and problems,you'll be good to go.

He is a pretty good prof. He makes math easier and makes the evening class fun. He has good notes and can explain concepts well. He is happy to help you with questions on math.  One of the best prof here. :)
HE IS SO PATIENT PRETTY A LOVELY GUY
Very good with proving formulas for better understanding.
She is a nice prof

She teaches you the most random thing and they don't come in your midterms or final exam, she is basically just uttering nonsense in class then study by your self. You can pass just by studying by yourself the class is pointless

She's really good, YES, You gonna have a lot of assignments, but honestly doing her assignments is the only way to succeed in this course and understand.
She is always willing to help and had 3 office hours, her exams were EASY, and she is well organised. She gets angry when the students don't do their assignments, cuz she cares.
Very nice and sweet.

She's a really nice professor, super sweet and always willing to help whenever you have any questions. Her class can be harder than some other Math100 profs in FIC so if you have a strong math background, take it with her !!! I was pretty sure that i was going to fail the class but she gave me a passing grade.

- Malcolm :)))))

Bad explanations, could've simplified it but always chooses not to. Her exam papers are WAY HARDER than other MATH100 profs. One plus point is that she gives perfect scores for home assignments (you still need to show that u finished it), though it is only 5% of your total score.
she is bad at explanation. if you ask her to help with exercises she will force another student to help you.
She speaks utterly slow, she doesn't explain good, her class is beyond boring. Dont take her, I ended up learning everything on my own with YT videos
She speaks really slow, often makes mistake and nor very good at explaining.
Her voice is hoarse. Personally, I think she is a very lazy teacher. She shows us the videos she recorded in the live class and often makes mistakes.
She is a good professor, but what she does sometimes makes people feel sick. For example, change the score ratio and suddenly increase the difficulty at the end of the semester.
her notes is very good , working hard then you can get good mark.

Pretty good teacher. Helps every time and occasionally gives good feedbacks on how to improve on certain aspects of Maths. Although, its kinda toughy to understand her accent but overall she is a pretty good maths instructor.

He is good. He needs to update his practise exams because some of them are from 2007. He also has a tendency to add questions that he never covered in class so you can lose marks on those.

Was he good? Yes. Would I take a course with him again? Probably not

Justin Chan was great for math 100! Didn't expect to do well considering I was below average in math in high-school but ended up with an A-, so don't be discouraged if you've previously had a hard time with math. He explains difficult concepts really well, 100% recommend taking any math courses with him.
Although the lectures were confusing and his time management was not the best all the time, the lectures were interesting and fun to attend. He explains things to the most little detail and point.
A great prof who goes the extra mile. I took him for Math 100 and he was always willing to help whenever I needed it. He was quite accessible via email and he really knows his stuff.

Professor Chan is an extremely caring professor. He always understood his students concerns and made adjustments to the class/assignments accordingly. He explains concepts very well also, he is slow but he makes sure everyone understands everything properly. Final exam was super hard tho.
super nice guy very quick to help students out

Took this course during COVID. Justins exams were easy if you practice a lot and ask for TAs and Prof feedback when studying for exams. Our class used Crowdmark and Mobius to complete math hw. He gives out extra sample questions during lecture for students to learn better. Midterms had similar questions to his sample mock papers.

Taken during COVID. During lectures he answers questions on the spot and is pretty good at explaining. He uses Crowdmark and Mobius for homework, and provides hints to the answers. He provides a review package before midterms/finals. "Lecture schedule" on Canvas is helpful to keep track of lectures and assignments. Overall, he is a good prof.

not the best at explaining, for the midterms he said we would not have to study a specific part however that showed up on the midterm. He is a kind hearted guy, hard to understand but he is alright. Math 100 is a hard class though, combines all material from grade 10 through 12.

Math 100 is a hard course, I would know as I took it 3 times. Thanks to Justin, the 3rd time was my last. He has great fill-in lecture notes, and is upfront with what will be contained in the weekly quizzes. Just do the written as assigned, and you will be prepared. He avoids much of the unneeded theoretical that confused me before. Approachable!

Justin Chan is an amazing math professor! If you're someone who struggles with math, consider taking a class with Justin. His quizzes are the exact same questions from his worksheets and the midterms and final are based on the quizzes! It is not difficult to do well in this class IF you show up, pay attention AND work hard! Do not fall behind.

I took this class as it's helpful for Math 157. Our class average was a "C" due to people thinking this class is an easy "A." Justin goes through his notes slowly and doesn't pack too much in per class. There are no surprises on his weekly assignemnts, nor on the exams. Go to class, attend tutorial if you need it, and do the assigments.
Assignments and notes are all available online. Encourages questions Lectures are clear
Ping Ding is a great prof for Maths... His exams are super duper easy !!! Go for it !! Easy A+

I had trouble understanding him sometimes, but besides that it was not bad. His exams are very fair, and he does tell you everything you need to know before the exams. Understand the material and you will be fine!

Good professor as long as you do all the homework and pass both midterms on the median or above median you will pass the course. Not sure about what ill get since he mislead us on the final. Which ended in a blood bath for a huge majority of the students. (Most people failed and left multiple questions blank)PS I don't think he wrote the final exam

Nice, sweet lady with an excellent attitude towards mathematics and her students. One of the only professors at SFU so far that replies to almost every single one of her emails. Has a bit of a thick accent that you need to get used to at the beginning of the semester. The course requires a lot of work, but highly recommended!

she has an accent and maybe her lectures can sometimes stray away from the material a bit, but nonetheless she cared a lot about her students and sent us emails before midterms&exams telling us exactly what to study for and encouraged students to review ahead of time so that we don't cram for them. overall a wonderful lady, sit upfront in lecture
she was awesome and its too bad that some people didn't get a chance to feel that way.

Ok so maybe she has an accent and maybe her lectures can sometimes stray away from the material a bit, but nonetheless she cared a lot about her students and even sent us emails before midterms&exams telling us exactly what to study for and encouraged students to review ahead of time so that we don't cram for them.

Her accent makes her difficult to understand. Yes it's true what others say she doesn't teach. Don't bother going to lectures. Just show up for the weekly quizzes at the end of class monday's. One of the TA's told me the first midterm class average was just over 50%. Final exam was very difficult.
She is very very nice and really helpful. I find that her homework is very helpful for quizzes, midterms, and finals. Just do all the homework and you'll ace the class.
Don't take math 100 with Malgorzata Dubiel. Any other math prof at sfu but her. She makes little sense at the end of lectures.
Warning, she is a nice lady but does not teach. Her lectures have little to do with the homework or the midterms. I find this class is extremely difficult with her teaching.

This woman is an absolute sweetheart who wants to see everyone succeed. Yes she has a thick accent, but I have never met a more helpful prof. She replies to every email about homework and actually helps you figure it out. Read the text BEFORE class, she only goes over the basics i/c. If you have to take Math, take it with her!!

shes a good prof but the reason im not a fan is b/c she talks to you as if you remember all the math you've ever done in highschool. i did very well in math but after not doing it for 2-3 years this class isnt that easy. her assumptions are way off, not everyone is fresh out of HS. the textbook is virtually useless as well.

Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. He's more interested in showing us how smart he is, in a rather snobby way. Unorganized lectures, terrible at teaching concepts. The textbook saved me, classes were a waste of time except used the iClicker for participation, which was a waste of my money since he didn't really use it as a discussion point. AVOID!

This may be essential if you want to do well in any Calculus courses, but it didn't help me for MATH 157. I did fair in this class, but that's because I worked hard and read the textbook, which explains more clearly than him. Avoid him at all cost. He doesn't even have PhD in Math nor has a background in it. He said it himself.

Terrible prof can't explain anything his midterms and tests are incredibly difficult and he's really arrogant and thinks he is really smart even though half the class is failing.  Avoid him at all costs...
He wears awesome shirts. His lectures are helpful if you do the assignments, but if you go to class without doing the assignments, you won't understand it.

WORST PROF. don't waste your time taking his class, you will not get a good grade. He somehow manages to complicate every lesson, making questions way more confusing than they actually are. Basically, you just end up using the textbook to teach yourself. Midterms are impossible. He is awful... just stay away and save your GPA.
Biggest waste of time and money. Horrible writing, horrible teaching techniques and horrible to look at.
this guy is an awful teacher. doesn't make any sense. he know his stuff but is horrible at explaining it. half the class is failing and he makes inappropriate comments about it all the time
The absolute worst prof I've ever had. Avoid this class if you can.

I've done Pre Calc in high school and I got a 72% but in Math 100, I have no idea what's going on. His penmanship is extremely messy, he goes over material too quickly and thinks everyone understands it instantly. His notes are confusing and his midterms are nothing like the past midterms. If I were you, avoid him as a professor at all costs.
Morland was not very helpful in lectures or in the open lab. If you actually want to get a good mark and learn then I wouldn't recommend him. Quizzes were based on the homework.

I've done precalculus before, and somehow he still managed to destroy me. He's more interested in proving how smart he is, rather than helping you learn. His penmanship is horrible and he can't spell to save his life, so good luck learning from the notes. I can't even express how much I dislike him. Run.
Buying an iclicker was a waste of my money. He only did polls for the first few classes then stopped doing them.
Very disrespectful to his students. Does not explain properly. You will be better off learning from the textbook. Just avoid this guy.
He is absolutely horrible! The midterms are not what you expect, he surprises you with questions he doesn't go over in class. Why would SFU hire this guy?
Does not help students. Hard to read hand writing. Awful professor overall. Do not recommend.
Do NOT take this class with him, you will regret it.
The only thing that keeps me going is overhearing other people say that they're just as confused as I am.

love the math themed shirts, not the prof. outbursts in class when people don't follow instructions (continue writing quiz after told to stop.) notes make no sense and he skips steps and flips equations around without explaining himself. teaches intro level math like his students are 4th year math students who already know the material. unhelpful.

Easily the worst professor around! No one will ever understand what he writes, and he doesnt explain anything properly. He expects everyone to know what he is talking about, and not helpful at all when asked for help on his workshop times
she's really good teacher and she explain things very well. and she always willing to help me understand the materials. on the other hand, exams were very tough.
She makes me think a lot in class when she goes over her notes in class--a good math teacher. She does makes mistakes once in a while but hey...any math teacher does that.
Good Prof.

MATH 232 Marks insanely hard. Makes you completely understand every last detail of the topic to get full marks(guess that's good but its so strict to the point where if you don't write 1 sentence explaining your answer, you won't get full marks even if you showed your work. She also rushes lectures and puts barely taught topics into midterms.
Very clear instructor with a practical grading criteria. Do your work and you will end up with a good mark.  Exams are very fair.
Helped me through precalc. very clear with her concepts and she is more than willing to spend the time out of class to make sure you understand it
great

She is an extremely arrogant professor, to say the least... I have no doubt she is great at mathematics but teaching it does not come naturally to her. I have never been treated worst by a professor in my entire university experience. She treats the students as if they are worthless animals and pays no attention to detail! Beware!!

Shes a great teacher, probably the best I've ever had. Explains everything crystal clear. Her notes are straight out of the textbook, and examples are way too easy. Weekly assignments are a joke compared to the tests. Be prepared to do hundreds of the most difficult examples to do well on tests. Class average was around 50% for all midterms/finals.

First off this course isn't too bad if you look at the material, what makes it hard is Petra's teaching style. Her notes are straight from the text and her examples are the easiest, even though those are nothing compared to examable questions. Your going to have to teach yourself and study hard. Exams are hard and class average is always low.

Amazing prof. I hate math and always failed at it in HS; for the first time in my life I'm getting good grades and actually understanding stuff. Menz shows enormous enthusiasm for Math and acts as if she genuinely wants us to do well. She seems really dedicated to teaching, unlike most of my profs who seem bored out of their minds.
SO bad. I agree with the person below me.. I have not learned a single thing from her even though I've gone and paid attention at every lecture...

She seems to think both a) that we're too dumb to understand proofs for theorems and b) that we already know the material we're there to learn. It's an insulting combination. Notes are right out of the textbook, so attendance isn't helpful. When the class avg. for midterm1 was 45% she said it was *our* fault, that we weren't trying hard enough.
This prof freaked me out in the beginning of the sem. But now, i miss the math ninja and her nazi regime ways in the lecture hall.
No Comments
Best instructor in FIC so far
Her lectures are very clear!

Amazing math prof! Her explanation videos were easy to follow, and if you still didn't understand she always saves time in class for questions, provided lots of additional resources to help you learn, and most of her lessons are spent working through examples to help you learn. Try to get her for MATH 100 and/or 151!!
She is an amazing professor. The lectures are clear, well-organized, and easy to follow. She is always patient and ready to help with any questions.
10/10 recommended. Although there were quizzes every week, but it's very easy and a great chance for you to revise for the lessons, so you guys wont be struggling that much in mid terms or finals ;D
Recommend if you are in FIC first or second term. One of the best teacher in my life!!!
Better read from book. unhelpful.

Math100 is a very basic math course for Year 1 student. Each class you have a small quiz, I guarantee that you will get at least 80%  if you listen while shes teaching. The two midterm and final exams are easy as long as you know all the knowledge in MATH100. A very lovely teacher and she is always willing to help.
An awesome teacher, made me fall in love with math. A 100% recommended teacher. Easy credits in math. Very understable lectures.

Nadia teaches good. I have taken this course as a IS1 course. So , it was really very fast and lots of work to do every week .We had to do 60-70 questions in 2 days and she selects 4 questions to grade from the whole 60-70questions . The quizzes are easy if we listen to the classes and revise all topics.I used textbook just to complete the homework

The professor gave lots of homework. Each class assignment will have at least 50 to 70 problems that you have to work on in the textbook. In addition, there are 10 additional questions in a single PDF. There are only about 2 days to finish it. Worst of all, she only chooses four questions in your homework to determine your grades.
She is very good at teaching, very polite and friendly. As due to pandemic FIC is conducting online classes that's why lectures are pre recorded.

she is the best teacher, she always has 3 office hours a week. Her assignment, quiz, and exam were easy as well. You just need to practice on her homework and focus on the lecture slide and then you will be fine. She very nice when you ask questions and mark easy
Ver accessible regardless of online classes, if you follow her lectures and visit her office hours you will get a good grade on this course.

The best math teacher I have had in a long time. Her online class lectures were clear and explained things in detail and she was available for office hours three times a week which is more then any other proffs. Super helpful and nice during office hours and knows how to explain things to get you to figure it out yourself without making you sweat.
She has the Best online class Structure! very caring and organized! You will love her if you take her as your instructor! You have to work hard to get a good grade thought!
Worst prof ever! Blabbers on.
Nice handouts that help me study efficiently before the exams, fair difficulty in the exam. Amazing explanation in math problems.
Awesome teacher. Take her cause she is great

Nadia is an amazing professor, she cares about your process and her class, The class would be hard if you don't have a good math background but she is really good explaining and her lectures are interesting. Above all the instructors giving math in FIC I would pick her without a doubt.
she does not explain she assume you know all the necessary content to solve the respective excercise. for me was the worst class ever

Nadia is an amazing professor, she gives good feedbacks and her office hours are very important. She also gives you tips to manage her subject with other courses. You need to be consistent in her classes. Her midterms are slightly challenging but if you do homework properly, its gonna be fine. Her final exams are also the usual.

Nadia's lectures are fun. If your phone rings during lecture, you'll be asked to bring timbits next week. She's my favorite instructor of this sem. I struggled a lot at the beginning as Nadia taught super quick but doing tb questions really helped. The average of each midterm is around 50-60% so is this a gpa booster course? I wouldn't say so.

Kind. Her notes and exam sheets are important. Clears confusions. Always helps others in problems if they call her.  Gives tips on how to do well in mid-term and final exams. Would love to be in her class again (Unfortunately, she's unavailable for next 8 months). Would also recommend others students to enrol in her class. And those lovely cookies.
The papers don't come from her class work, all form the textbook , which you gotta study on your own.
Very nice.
Nadia is a really nice instructor. I can tell that she loves math and she provides lecture notes each week to help students study. She also explains materials well!
I do like this prof,she is really a nice people,whos helpful,caredul and care about her students.take her class,u wont regret!

It seems previous years may have had it more difficult than others. The exams were really compose of everything from the notes and text (nothing you haven't seen before). Doing all those really gives you no reason to fail. She has a really sweet personality, which makes up for these dreaded 8:30 classes.

This is the easiest class you could ever take. I honestly cannot grasp the 40% fail rate. The exam and quizzes are examples from the lecture or questions from the homework. All you have to do is check your work over and you should get an easy A in a Q course at that. (this is from a history student who needed a q-course)

Nadia as a person is very kind, and very passionate about math. Assignments from the book are easy, lon capa requires only basic understanding, quizzes are from assignments, but the midterms combine the toughest concepts and questions. That was frustrating for me, to have never applied those concepts together before.

Really liked the lady.. if she sees you in the hallway, she will recognize you, and smile! However, the exam/midterms do not reflect what has been taught in class and what is in the book! The final really had nothing to do with the book!

Very clear when teaching. Will aptly answer questions in class. Goes at a good pace and will adjust if class is struggling. Accent is super cute and she always says "good morning!" which was nice for a 8:30am class. Work hard and very possible to get a good mark.

Solid good prof. Very accessible and friendly when approached for help, whether after class or at workshop. Notes can be a bit deceiving, as in class examples WAY easier than what she will test you on. Trick is to not rely on notes but do hardest questions in book.

lectures rarely provide any additional insight beyond what is in the textbook. In fact, the explanations in the book are usually much more clear. Exams do not reflect what she covers in class at all, and are usually quite tricky.
One of the worst profs I've ever had. She is hard to understand and very disorgainized. I found her notes unhelpful as well as her explinations. Do not take this class if she's teaching it!
Clear and straightforward. Hot as well!
Best teacher ever! Midterm/final exams questions = lecture note questions/homework problems but the numbers are changed. Easiest a I have ever earned!

hated math, LOVED this prof! has such a sweet attitude and gives clear and concise notes. her tests are also freakishly easy and exactly like hw assignments. no curveballs whatsoever. wish she taught calculus
She's cool

VERY disorganized lectures. She often does not do what is on the course notes, and adds random bits and piece. and more importantly, DOES NOT HAVE LECTURE RECORDINGS. This professor lives in the freaking stone age, she doesn't use a projector either.
Her tests are insanely hard despite the other raters. Midterms are nothing like what you learn in class.
Easy course but everything can be learned on your own using the textbook. If you study her notes and review instead of the textbook you will do poorly on the midterm.

She's very nice and helpful. Very clear too considering her accent.Gives several examples to make it easier to understand the lesson. Smiles a lot, which shows that she isn't the cold, cranky and unsocial professor stereotype.

Great professor. Goes the extra mile to help her students. Very clear in her lectures and notes. Exams are fairly easy. She really cares for her students and tries to make sure everyone does well. Highly recommend taking her as a professor. Overall a very nice person. Take math 100 with her.

Provides lecture notes that is easy to follow. The test are more than fair very easy. She is a very helpful prof because she explains materials very clearly and shows you the easiest and hard method for solving questions.

She is a very good math professor. She provides lecture notes which you can follow during her explanations and she is very clear explaining the reasonings and methods for solving questions. Her test are more than fair, its easy.

She's a really dedicated teacher. She makes the Calculus become much more easier for her students. She also provides wide knowledge and fair exams. Trust me if you are hard - working, MATH 157 with Cory will not be anymore difficult!
Explains everything well. Her notes are great
Good person and teacher
Great teacher

I can not speak for the people that took upper level math courses. He had easily understandable notes. He puts a variety of questions on the exams, which I love because most professors focus on a certain chapters and If you dont understand that chapter but understand everything else, the mark wont reflect your knowledge on the course...
Doesn't teach any of the questions that are on the exam.

didnt care about student learning, his main focus was just to get through the material he had to. rarely replied to emails, especially if they were concerning grades. his class examples were taken from the textbook but he explained them in a much more confusing way. he is only a masters student and has a long way to go if he wants to become a prof.

Although midterm 2 was quite the disaster, the final itself (worth 50%) was not too bad, and this is from a person who literally studied for it on the morning of. Do the HW, visit the TAs if you have any questions or don't understand a concept, and honestly you should do fine. Though grades haven't come out yet, the final this sem was fair.

There is a huge difference between the notes from the lecture and the actual works. He did the simplest examples and the test questions are way harder. Homework questions are always posted later than told. Many errors with grades.

This prof was not good at all, he was consistently late for class and would blame it on the bus. He also moved through material really fast and, like others have already said, would give simple examples in lecture and have much more complicated homework questions. Overall, not a good prof

Adam's an adequate prof. Midterm #1 was incredibly easy; the 2nd requires much more understanding. Although there is a notable difference in the simplicity of the lecture material and that on the exam(s), hw and quizzes are very doable. Quizzes are derived straight from the hw questions and TAs are readily available. Plan for much self-studying.

Adam is so diosrganized, rolls into class 10 mins late almost every class. Does not help prep you for an exam whatsoever. Does easy examples in class and posts practice exams the day before the exam. First midterm average was normal. Second midterm was 35% and he said he wont be curving it? Makes sense. Overall would not reccomend.

Adam is a okay prof, first midterm was nice and easy and the second one was brutal. He is organized and is accessible out of class. The in class quizzes are easy as they are straight of the textbook. He explains concepts clearly. The level of difficulty between in class and hw is somewhat unfair and he needs to provide more practice exams.

Adam is not a good professor. His lectures are just him doing easy example problems. He is not good at explaining what he is doing or why and talks in a voice so monotone it's reminiscent of getting served by miserable minimum wage worker at your local Mc D's. He is also sarcastic and doesn't really appear to care how his students do in the class.

He is always late, doesn't know his own syllabus, doesn't know why there are grading mistakes or changes in assignment dates. Very bad explainer and when you ask for clarification he goes back and explains it the same way...

Adam gives you way too much work that doesn't even help come quiz and midterm time. Explains the most basic examples during lecture and then has way harder questions on the quizzes and midterms. I would only recommend this course if you need it to get into another man one. Thank god I studied precal before doing this class with this guy

He is usually late for every class even though I see him walking in the hallways near the lecture hall... He moves through concepts very quickly and does not take time to elaborate on anything. Weekly Quizzes are also his flaw as he uses easy examples in lecture and switches it up to hard questions on the quiz. Does not seem to care about teaching

He is late for almost every class. His lectures are extremely dry, and he does not really explain the concepts clearly. His examples are too easy and the questions on quizzes are much harder so you are not prepared for the test questions. He also has the most monotone voices and sounds like he hates teaching, which makes it hard to learn in class

Adam may move quickly through concepts as mentioned in other reviews, but that is to be expected in a university course. He asks lots of questions to encourage participation and group learning and it's not his fault when he is left with no response. He is very clear about what is expected and seems to care about the success of his students.
She is one amazing prof. I wish SFU had more teachers like her. Overall she makes your journey an easy pleasant one.

I came from a different university where I had horrible math experiences, so Sophie is a breath of fresh air. She is younger, more relatable, and keeps up a good energy during lectures which keeps it from getting boring. I personally thinks she does a good job at demonstrating and explaining concepts.

She is not very good when it comes to explaining concepts. I was expecting her to treat the students as if they have no higher level math background (some dont) but she tends to quickly go over things without properly explaining them or saying how she got the answer It is so frustrating Unnecessarily difficult textbook questions dont match lecture

You could tell he was a bit nervous teaching.  He's very intelligent and smart, sometimes has a tough time understanding why others cant grasp concepts as quickly as him.  Is willing to help, nice guy.  Attend workshops.  Class is scaled.  Practice exams weren't relevant for many exam questions. Its a math course, its hard, so put in the effort.

This was Dr Knox's first semester teaching, and he did a spectacular job. His lectures were very clear and notes were helpful. Was always on time in the workshop during his assigned hours, and even stayed beyond them to help! Don't expect and easy A, you really have to work for the grade. Must do homework and review after every class.
not too bad.
his notes are great. the quizzes are based on the homework assignment. his tests are not that hard if you understand the concepts. I am not a math genius, but I did well in this class.

Knox is passionate about math and you can tell from his lectures; but, since he hasn't had much exposure to the teaching world, he doesn't know how to explain things in lamen terms. If you ever needed help, all you needed to do was ask- but hopefully you can understand the dialect of calculus!
Friday is my final and I regret all my life choices that has led me to take fiachra's math 100 class. Stay away from this prof if possible.

1.) Exams are harder than my physics and chemistry ones. 2.) Textbook questions do not relate to the style of his questions in his exams 3.) Cannot simplify material when teaching. 4.) Doesnt have enough examples of his style of questions.

Math is not going to be easy if you don't work hard. He will not spoon feed you. If you brush-up on your basic math skills before coming to class you will be fine. Lot of people say that his exams are nothing like his revision sheets, and I disagree. He just words the questions different. He is obviously not going to give you the same questions!
His lectures are very unorganized and rather uninformative.  Many key aspects are skipped through. Fiachra is very smart and nice but does not seem suited for teaching at all.

Dr. Knox is a solid math professor. Given that you have the pre-requisites and decent math ability needed to succeed in precalccalc, you should do just fine. I find the real fault is in the course itself rather than the prof because many of the lectures focus on unnecessary proofs that aren't on exams. Exams are hard, but not impossible.

Unnecessarily hard midterms using questions way beyond the scope of a math 100 class. Does not explain the content thoroughly and constantly makes major mistakes in his powerpoints. I would not recommend this professor to anyone

He's really smart with math no doubt, just not at teaching it. Like not good at all. Like terrible. Really nice guy, but you tend to forget when you're in his lecture because they're fairly bland and frustrating. You're better off reading the textbook and teaching yourself.

Great guy, works really hard for us by making review sheets and telling us what questions to do in order to do well on the quizzes. Slides are really  helpful if you don't like reading book.. he's easy to talk to, young guy so he understands the struggle. Awesome

I always enjoyed lectures by Dr. Knox, because he pauses every few sentences to allow students to catch up with his reasoning, and accepts lots of questions. He's very friendly, and I found his marking to be fair. Be sure to study previous midterms and his revision worksheet-HUGE help! Really enjoyed this class, even though I usually dislike Math.

New prof.. however, he's done a very admirable job. He has office hours 3 days a week, prepares detailed study guides for the exams, replies fast, helpful. Uber smart guy so I can understand how it can be sometimes hard to explain material. Tests are difficult.. do well with practice. Dude is polite, approachable, and definitely helped my learning.

I think this is fiachra's first year teaching. He seems very inexperienced and is unable to explain concepts. Even with precalc experience, this course is very difficult. His midterms are tougher than textbook questions and his review sheets are irrelevant to what's on the midterms. I wouldn't recommend this prof to anyone.

extremely bad math professor.  Doesn't have enough copies of the exam on exam days and unable to teach properly. He explains the material in a way that only he understands. Constant mistakes on his slides and unclear criteria. Does not deserve to teach

He's good at math but cant dumb it down AT ALL. Everything is powerpoint which he screws up every class & on canvas. He explains things in a way that makes the material greatly more difficult! His tests are much harder than prior exams. I stopped going to class and my math skills have improved. Waste of $. You're screwed without the text.

Simply the worst professor I've had. His explanations are just horrific. It's as though he covers material under the assumption that we know it all already. He also adds confusing examples and blazes through them assuming we all can keep up. Also, his Victorian Era style of speech makes the concepts appear even more daunting, and hard to grasp.
Makes simple concepts very complicated and can not explain topics in plain english. The only reason i go to class is for the iclicker mark. Would not recommend

I took math 100 for the 2nd time with Dr. Knox. I failed it the first time around and Dr. Knox is infinitely better at teaching math that my previous prof.   For whatever reason, lots of SFU profs are stuck in the 80s and are apparently allergic to technology. Knox uses PowerPoint slides, so skipping won't be a death sentence. Math 100 is tough
intelligent man, great prof
thoroughly enjoyed the class... not for you if you don't like math.. very smart teacher and is very helpful if he thinks you're worth his time
his lectures always go off topic. He teaches math for maybe 5 minutes and strays towards other topics totally unrelated to math..his midterms were fine..final was hard..but crappy lecturer

Easiest prof ever.  Midterms and final were easier than homework (which was also easy).      Average on midterms/final should have been much higher!  Kind of boring, but a good prof to get an easy A with...
he goes off on tangets to nowhere but his examples are good, notes suck. somehow manages to tangle himself in his own mike EVERY class.
notes were okay, good examples, good consistency with tests etc.
Spends 1/2 class talk'n 'bout nut'n. Nut'n accomplished. Oblivious to questions.
he likes to tell stories about how the pythag theorem came into exsitence
BEST PROF EVER! JUST TAKE HER CLASS, YOU WON'T REGRET IT!!!

the review is extremly helpful and try to attend to the class as much as youu can even she wouldn't mark the attendancy. her finanl is a bit hard but you would be fine if you do the assignment and listen to the class.
Excellent instructor, very clear and helpful. Her classes were easy to follow and she gave great lecture notes. And she's really friendly and approachable. I would take her class again.

Margot was a great teacher, had her in my first semester after coming off a tough year in math previously. Math 100 is a fast paced course but she is very open and helpful to questions. Super approachable and is willing to answer all your questions! I hate math and I would take a course with her again in a heartbeat!

Despite attending EVERY class, passing every assignment, and being tutored by a STAT major, I failed this course. Margot, while sweet, is NOT used to teaching large lecture-style courses or writing appropriate exams. Our class felt like a training course for her, and it is a real shame that many of our grades were at the mercy of her inexperience.
Professor does not know anything about the lessons

he does not know how to teach, generally, he makes stupid mistakes and he can not control the lecture at all. everybody is talking during his lectures and no one can focus on the unclear way of teaching he has at all!

In math 110 right now with him. He's actually pretty nice and makes the math we learn straight forward. He doesn't trick you on exams too. Just study and participate in class, hoping to end this sem with an A. Be wary, he's very against cheating and can get mad if the class doesn't follow his instructions. Just practice and you're going to do good.

hes really chill, some of his methods are a little outdated but you can easily just go on youtube to figure some things out. quizzes are free marks, just beware of midterms and finals. other than that, not a big course to stress on. cool guy

T Archie is the BEST! Makes math FUN! 8:30 lectures are awful but he makes life worth living. Weekly quizzes but only 2 questions, lots of chances to boost your mark. If you need to take math, take it with him! He's quirky and witty and loves his history. He's been doing this a long time so he gets it and he understands the student life!
an amazing prof, super understanding and easy going!

As someone who is learning most of the content for the first time, Archie does not explain what is going on in anyway that makes sense for me. He gets example questions wrong and doesnt correct them, which is a pain in the ass for someone who doesnt understand. He doesnt upload complete notes so review is nearly impossible using only course content

Really easy to talk to, and super nice guy. And, he's had a solid background teaching mathematics in China(?) and also some part in Europe(?) Also very passionate about his field as demonstrated in the interesting, and funny stories he ties into the lectures related to math.
Good prof. went through the material pretty fast but gave good explanations of everything. You can skip a few classes here and there but don't miss too many or you will fall behind.

His course is very simple, you have the skeleton notes and you can fill it in during class. There are weekly online assignments that are simple, and weekly quizzes that are simple. Overall straight forward class, Tom himself is a great person.

Professor Levit did a very good job in his first semester at SFU. He was very attentive to his emails, and would answer in depth to questions. He is also very helpful in office hours. This course requires A LOT of at home practice, and this is YOUR responsibility. Do not expect to attend lectures and think you are adequately prepared. Thank you ML!

Really nice guy but really confusing lectures. This prof sometimes messes up notes and his explanations of the concepts from the slides are very vague and unclear. Make sure u go to tutorials its free marks and the TAs are helpful. If u study u'll be fine the tests aren't that bad.

He does not explain things properly, so get ready to rely on the textbook. I attended every lecture, but honestly, you are better off just reading the textbook as it provided a better explanation than he did. When he tries to solve a problem from his own slides, he often gets stuck and says that he will post the answer on canvas. Try to avoid!

I didn't feel like he was a good teacher because he didn't go over concepts that well in class, and it was hard to follow what he was saying. You are better off watching videos of the concepts to understand the class(which I did). My advice is make sure you keep up to the lectures as much as you can, so things can make sense while you're in class.

Max is a nice guy! Not a great prof though. Initially, I cut him some slack since it's his first semester, but I am paying for this course! He did not know how to work through problems on HIS slides during lectures and often gave wrong answers. His tests are hard and online assignments take forever just to not have relevance for tests. Avoid!

worst professor I've ever had. In my opinion he is neck to neck with Marie Loughin (IYKYK). I unfortunately had to take this class in his first semester teaching at SFU and during the strike. During the midst of the strike he was so courteous that he canceled class and provided us with his blank slides. Thank you for declining my will to live.

I found tutorials the most beneficial part of the entire course, and did most of my learning from the textbook. The final was very long and there was a weekly quiz and a weekly assignment. Overall not bad.

He occasionally makes mistakes when working problems in the class but fixes them in class which I find to be really helpful. His lectures can be a little confusing sometimes but talking to him one-on-one during office hours usually clears up any things I don't understand.

His class is quite easy and much better than my previous precalc experiences. Hes a caring prof who will respond to your emails quick + lots of easy marks w/ quizzes + hw + tutorial. Sometimes he does mess up on solutions during lecture, but he quickly fixes his mistakes (this honestly helpful since it helps me not make same mistakes). 10/10 prof

It feels like he doesn't really know what he's saying most of the time. His lectures are super unorganized and it seems like he's going through the content for the first time during lecture. He is a nice guy, but I find he doesn't answer questions very clearly. Wouldn't really recommend him...

Prof just reads over slides and doesn't really explain how he gets to each step. His writing on the board is not legible whatsoever so sometimes I don't even know what I am writing or reading myself. I stopped going to some lectures because he barely teaches the content well and I end up using Glaser Tutoring Company on YouTube.
Does not explain concepts well and is difficult to follow because of the lack of coherency.
lectures really hard to follow and the slides that he shows are his first time reading it as well

so far, he seems like a nice guy but does not teach math well. He does not explain concepts or class solutions for the beginner level and assumes everyone already knows the class material. He simply just glosses over slides and does half done solutions. TAs are nice and patient though - and are willing to break down the problems with you.

Overall, the class was pretty easy since it's like a review of Math 12. But the online assignments are hard to do sometimes (at first they were really easy tho). Also, it is hard to contact him, I emailed him about the final and he never replied. If you want to do well in this class then do the textbook hw and attend lectures.

Luis is always full of energy and makes you want to pay attention during an 8:30 class. He even gave out prizes!  What he explained was made clear however, I can't really say how "good" he was because I found I used the textbook to understand most of the hw questions and test questions. I found it great as it broke down the answers into steps.
Pretty funny guy, makes the class fun for being at 8;30 in the morning.

He was pretty good, really cleared up the material during lectures. Book was crap, so attending lectures is a biggy. Exams overall were fair and assignments were relatively easy and relavent. Was late to almost every lecture however.

Was very cheerful and open to helping students but was late to every single lecture. I recommend going to every lecture as I found that his notes are much easier to understand than the textbook. His exams were fair; just make sure you understand what was taught in class.

Always late for classes and making mistakes during lectures. Hes not giving the online notes away, you can only read the textbook when you missed class (but the textbook sucks) The course is easy, but the prof is terrible, questions on the exams aren't the things that we learnt in lectures. Unfair. Take this course with other prof if you need it.
He is SO hilarious! he is always so happy and does twirls all the time and bounces left right and centre. He is great if you want to smile and learn :)
His writing makes it hard to follow. He needs to improve his ogranizational skills but a very nice goofy guy.
Very nice, helpful, and fun!
very nice, easy, clear

Navid is a very good professor, he is nice and explain things well and is helpful during office hours. I am not very confident in my math skills but I can say that I learned more this semester than all of high school combined!

Navid is a really nice professor as he always provide the support you needed in class. He is quite fast at his lectures but if you are used to it, you will understand his expectations and the materials. He explains everything thoroughly and you don't need to do any extra self-learning in home. He is also very understanding of his students.
Great content, accessible outside class and the concept/formulas are easy to comprehend as long as you pay attention during class.

When I was taking his course, he would set up office hours 4 times a week. That's enough time for me to ask questions and understand. He gives partial marks for weekly quizzes and exams, so even if you are not good at math like me, you can get not bad grade.
Great prof, explain in detail to make sure anyone can understand. However, you need to pay attention in class and do practices in order to get a good grade.

I think Navid is a very good teacher. Although his mid terms are quite difficult, trust me its gonna help a lot to you in your finals. I was able to perform my final successfully because of doing all this practice question in the assignments and quizes. Thank You Navid!
He teaches too fast in the class and often skips a few topics. He often gives homework question which are really tough and his exams are also hard to think.
Very great teacher with an extensive understanding of mathematics And I like his teaching strategies Exam were not so difficult Maybe a little more difficult than the class subject

Would not recommended taking the professor. Does not teach well at all, only mentions the concept and explains the simplest sums, but doesnt say anything when its come to the hardest solving sums. Didnt give tips or extra practice for the final exam. Also, does not even solve doubts well leaving you more confused.

I literally failed math 100 when I took it with some other professor but when I took it with Navid, the course changed entirely. I started to enjoy the course and within 4 months of work with Navid I rose from F to an A. I guess this is pretty self explanatory about the professor on how he takes his class and how he teaches.
He teaches the necessary stuff and doesn't waste time on unusual things

I dont know why so many people dislike his teaching but actually I think hes a nice and friendly professor. Hes willing to provide help and care students learning. He taught quite slowly in my class that even though professor in other class was teaching chapter 3, we were still in chapter 2. He did not spend a lot of time on sin cos tan.

Very good professor of maths. Always teaches well and you can ask him as many doubt you want. His lectures are interesting and easy. If you are regular and do all the assignments, you can easily score good marks.

I held off on writing this review, but after having 5 different professors in the math department at SFU, i can easily say professors like Navid are why people hate math. He left such a bad taste in my mouth that i DREADED math. Thankfully, I actually have a competent professor this term. Seriously, do not take him unless youve already taken this.
He teaches very detailed, but sometimes the teaching speed is slow.
He is there if you need help. He is hard marker though! But if u catch up with all the lectures and attend office hours you'll do good!

It was one of his first semesters teaching and you could tell he was still learning how to teach. He started off not-so-great, but after the first midterm, he seemed to improve his teaching style. He's nice, reasonable, and helpful in office hours. I think with a bit more experience he'll be as good a lecturer as you can expect for a math course.

Navid himself clearly cares about his students. When I went in for help, he was always available to help me and talk with me. As a person he's cool. However, as a prof he is vague, moves over topics too quickly and is a seriously hard marker. Currently, I only know one person passing the courses. I would recommend avoiding this class at all costs.

Absolutely horrible. He explains the most basic of concepts that are easily learned in less than 20 minutes of reading the textbook. His lectures do not at all reflect the difficulty of the tests. Taking this class is comparable to Eddard Stark's death, except you replace Eddard Stark with your GPA.

Clearly loves teaching the subject! He can be a bit unclear at times but he will clarify as often as you need to. Really cares about his students! You have weekly assignmens that aren't graded but are a must if you want to get a good grade in this course.

Absolutely dreaded this class. It was honestly the hardest thing I've ever done since I'm not efficient in grasping math concepts. When I went for help in the workshops, there wasn't much that he helped me with. (Wasn't much clarifications) If you know that you'll struggle, don't take it with him. You'll just be frustrated and lost.

You can tell he tries, but fails miserably - very similarly to me in his class. He focuses so extensively on small basic concepts. Gives little to no examples in class, and if any, they are nothing like what you will see in your homework  let alone your tests. Avoid if possible, if not don't rely on him to learn anything. Good luck.

Navid is super caring and helpful to students. Even the most lost students, he'll spend lecture time making sure the class understands the material rather than pushing it off on students. Average amount of work for a math class, but he's an amazing prof.

She is the best teacher EVER. She is an asset to this university, and deserves to be recognize. Not only does she makes math fun, she is super inspirational during her lectures, and encourages you to see math as a friend and not as an enemy. She will assign a lot of homework, not to make you angry but to get you into the habit of practicing.

Dr. Drakes is not a bad math teacher. She is funny so her lectures aren't boring. Her exams can be challenging but they are fair. She encourages questions, and is always happy to answer them. Sometimes she picks on random people to answer questions in lecture though. I didn't find her rude.. don't take her jokes too seriously.

At  first, I was scared to take a math course, but her optimistic personality and encouraging teaching skills gave my hope to stop being afraid of math.  Just because the class is hard doesn't mean it's the teacher's fault.  She is one of the best math teachers in the school. I would recommend to take classes with her :)!!

Dr.Drakes is quite the amazing individual, incredibly hilarious with her sarcastic remarks that made me actually want to go to class. Midterms, quizzes, and the final were based directly form the text book. BUY THE TEXT BOOK AND DO THE QUESTIONS. If you study/prepare this way you will be guaranteed at least a B+.

She is a caring instructor but her lectures might be a bit difficult to understand at first as her voice isn't very loud. Although her classes may seem boring, she would help any student if they just ask her questions. She appreciates class participation and if you pay attention to the quizzes and sample questions, you should do well in her exams.
No help whatsoever. Demotivates students who doesn't know how to do problems. Be prepared to self-teach if you're in her class.
She is nice, but it took me a while to understand her European accent. As long as you make good use of her notes and do some extra practices, you will be fine (A range)
Take at your own risk.
Nice person. Extremely bad prof. Recommend you not to take.

She's quite rude and expects you to know the material. I asked her what I did wrong in a question and she said everything in a very condescending manner. Her thick accent interrupts is hard to understand which makes it difficult to comprehend. I don't understand how some people find her appealing. Her classes are a basically self-teach class.
Not recommended.

He always seemed to be confused when he was teaching us. The exams were difficult and unrelated to what was assigned in homework. When I had him in my MATH157 as a sub, he managed to confuse everyone.

Probably the most fruitiest math teacher ive ever had. His notes are all over the place,frequent mistakes which r sometimes never corrected. I attended every class, took notes, reviewed, but the midterm and the Final were extremely difficult.He made the final exam worth 75% of our grade...GPA KILLER

You need prior knowledge to understand this course because there is definetly no review for those of us who don't remember everything about gr.12 math. He is so hard to pay attention to, jumps around the boards and doesn't engage the class at all. The exams were very hard, you need to be able to go above and beyond. Seeing him for extra help is som

Worse math 100 prof ever. Has no respect for students or questions they have. Ignorant. Not helpful. Makes a load of mistakes, stutters, rubs his bisceps too much, stutters, says "um". Not always available for help, don't even go to him for help. If you have him, good luck =.=! Our class avg on midterm 30-40%. CHICKEN XD!!!!

Randall Pyke is a very ridiculous professor. The notes he gives in class are the exact same from the textbook; no point in going to his lectures. His exams are beyond entry levels. He expects you to know everything on exams and it is very time consuming to do the questions. Usually no one finishes his exams and leave 1-2 Q's out. Stay away from him

Pyke's exams are insane for an entry level math class.  Though he is certainly a nice person and helpful, he seems to be overburdened and limited on time.  Lack of organization is another fault, had the largest homework of the semester due 2 days before a final that was 25 pages long.  I would avoid, if possible.

Do not take math with this guy. I think he is too advanced to be teaching a beginner level calc course, the lectures do not make any sense whatsoever. I taught myself from the text, which is useless because his exams don't reflect the book at all. His notes are disorganized and all over the place, he makes lots of mistakes in lectures, good luck!
I agree with everyone here, VERY boring prof who won't do anything to perk up students and is difficult to follow/understand at times.
So so
Dr. Jungic is very passionate about math, which makes him such an engaging teacher. He cares a lot about his students and wants everyone to succeed. One of the best teachers I've ever had.
He is amazing and his class is very easy for us to understand.
Veselin is a great professor, he takes the time to make sure everybody is caught up to speed, loves to answer questions. He also makes Mathematics very easy to understand.

Respectable professor with fair exams, good lectures, and very generous office hours. If you're taking MATH 100 with him, just got to lectures, do the assignments, and do every question on his sample exams (almost identical to his real exams) and you'll do just fine. Dr. J's MATH 100 class is great primer for MATH150/154/157, definitely recommend.

Dr.J is truly just amazing and you can feel that he cares about the students. I have nothing bad about him to say. I took math 100 to get ready for 157 and it definitely helps. He gave exams that are very much the same as practice exams that are composed of old exams, maybe it is only in Math 100, but maybe not. I wish he is teaching Math 157 now!!

The best math proffessor I have ever had. He cares more than anybody else about his students and giving you whatever help you need to pass. Seriously, give him a minute of your time and he will do everything to teach you. long assignments, but TONS of sample midterms/finals, study the additional q's on the quizzes, they basically make up the final.
Prof is difficult to understand. Horrible handwriting and unclear notes.

Dr. Jungic is an exceptional professor. Extremely kind, extremely caring, always available to help. His exams were practically identical to his practices, so make sure to go over that and understand the questions because some are basically copied and pasted into the exams. Weekly quizzes are identical to homework from the textbook, not his lecture.

Taught my MATH100 class. An absolute badass at math. He usually teaches upper level mathematics but took FALL2016 to teach MATH100. Teaches with dedication. Does his best to make sure you understand, especially during office hours. Extremely approachable, caring and dedicated. If you have any questions, email him, set a time to meet him.

The best professor I've had. Lectures are organized and clear. Very encouraging and willing to help anyone who is willing to ask. He was available for plenty of office and tutorial hours. His expectations are high, but he is very fair.

Favourite prof so far. He rewards hard work, and does his best to explain even the simplest concepts so that everyone is on the same page. He even cared to learn the names of half the class! Tip: study the practice exams he gives, as the questions are identical to the real exams. They even had some of the same values.

This noble man goes above and beyond for his students. Available almost every day for 23 hours for help. Lectures are extremely intuitive, he knows exactly what the level our class is at and adjust accordingly. Put my math career back on track. If you have him, be grateful and PRACTICE REGULARLY. Very fair marker.

I took Math 100 before with Nancy Khalil and failed it... she would rush through problems without explaining clearly. But now I'm really understanding the material thanks to professor Jungic's lectures. He's able to explain things in a way the average person who isn't strongest in math can understand. An excellent teacher and really helpful

Very helpful friendly and approachable. No tricks up his sleeves, will tell you what you need to know. Loves when people ask questions, so don't be shy to. Gives sample exams before each one but without the solutions. Theres clicker participation. There's weekly quizzes based off the homework he assigns and also easy loncapa. DON'T BE LATE TO CLASS

Honestly, one of the best profs I've had at SFU. His lectures go by very quickly and his explanations are clear and concise. If you don't understand something, he'll make sure you do. Really there for you and is always offering help to his students whether in office hours or the algebra workshop! Super sweet, adorable and amazing!
His course is a little bit difficult compared with the other courses which are the same level.Anyway,to study with him is challenging and students can really learn sth important.
Excellent!
